books.title: Pudd’nhead Wilson
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A small-town lawyer unravels a complex web of switched identities and exposes the true nature of individuals in a racially divided society.

books.title: The Master of Ballantrae
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: The relationship of two noble brothers is blighted by hostility and vengeance in Jacobite Scotland.

books.title: The Story of My Life
books.author: Helen Keller
books.summary: Helen Keller writes about her experiences as a deafblind child learning to communicate.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: Hindu Tales from the Sanskrit
books.author: S. M. Mitra
books.summary: Short stories and fables from the Sanskrit tradition.

books.title: The Importance of Being Earnest
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A comedy skewering Victorian high society.

books.title: The Duchess of Malfi
books.author: John Webster
books.summary: A widow marries beneath her station and against her brothers’ orders and, enraged, they take their revenge.

books.title: The Chessmen of Mars
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: Tara, Princess of Helium and daughter of John Carter, finds life-threatening adventure in thrilling far-off regions of Barsoom.

books.title: Dodsworth
books.author: Sinclair Lewis
books.summary: A newly-retired businessman’s peaceful European trip falls apart as his wife chases high European society.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: M. R. James
books.summary: A collection of ghost stories written by M. R. James.

books.title: Commentaries on the Gallic War
books.author: Julius Caesar
books.summary: Julius Caesar’s account of the conflicts between Rome and Gaul in the later years of the Roman republic.

books.title: Inspector French’s Greatest Case
books.author: Freeman Wills Crofts
books.summary: An inspector is called in to investigate the murder of a diamond trading firm’s employee and the theft of their jewels.

books.title: Roads to Freedom
books.author: Bertrand Russell
books.summary: Bertrand Russell investigates the merits and potential shortcomings of different socialist tendencies.

books.title: What’s Wrong with the World
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: Philosopher G. K. Chesterton comments on various social issues of his day, including property, imperialism, feminism, and education.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.summary: Dante journeys through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven in order to receive salvation and to find divine love.

books.title: Crome Yellow
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.summary: A young writer travels to an English countryside manor to spend the summer alongside a cast of outlandish leisure class intellectuals.

books.title: The Purple Cloud
books.author: M. P. Shiel
books.summary: A young adventurer embarks on a polar expedition, only to return to an unbelievably different world.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: M. R. James
books.summary: A collection of ghost stories written by M. R. James.

books.title: Polynesian Mythology
books.author: George Grey
books.summary: A collection of Māori mythology covering the start of the universe through to the spread of Māori tribes through New Zealand’s North Island.

books.title: The Path to Rome
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a walking pilgrimage to Rome from his hometown in France, writing of the journey, sketching the sights, and digressing on a wide variety of subjects.
